This game is flat out amazing. It had a way of challenging my brain but it never felt frustrating. It had one plot twist that I somehow did not see coming, hilarious dialougue, and an overall interesting story. I am yet to play co-op (mainly because I don't have friends) but I am sure it would be just as funny. One warning I will give you, however, get used to seeing your palm in your face. Overall I give it a 10/10.

Questo (insieme al primo) sono i veri capolavori di Valve, non certo Half Life...
Il gioco è stupendo, rispetto al primo capitolo offre una storia meglio narrata e più varia nel gameplay, una modalità coop (che ho appena iniziato ma già si preannuncia divertente) e una miriade di contenuti creati dagli utenti, alcuni davvero fantastici.
Tutti dovrebbero giocarlo.

Where the first game was well paced and ended when it ran out of tricks, this sequel is longer than it is interesting. The introduction of new elements are too little too late and they are given to the player at a glacial place.

If you've got a friend, the multiplayer is worth while as it offers more brain bending than the solo campaign.

The concept of Portal and Portal 2 is brilliant, inventive, challenging, and fun.  Mind-bending spatial logic puzzles.  I love the new puzzles and elements of Portal 2.  Clever and funny plot/story as well.  The ability to play user-created levels is awesome and allows for essentially infinite play FOREVER!
Good Game to play in coop with a friend.

A number of people don't like Portal 2 as much as Portal for two reasons:

1. The game play is more linear
2. There is more characterisation

I can see why this is a criticism, however, while the problems can now often only be solved one way, I found the story to be engaging and the improved characterisation of the villain made up for it.   In fact there were times where I found the puzzles distracting me from the story and was annoyed I had to complete them to learn more.

Yet in this frustration lies Portal 2's real charm....it is still a joy to play even when it's annoying you!

The multi-player is a very well handled feature that adds a lot of replay value, especially with the workshop to create your own levels of torture.

There's one other reason to get this game, but

*** SPOILERS ***

For fans of the first game, it's worth playing just to see GLaDoS turned into a vegetable :)
